paragraph.heading: 1Web Service Client Project Wizard
paragraph.paragraph: This wizard enables you to create an Eiffel project which communicates with an existing web service.
paragraph.heading: 2Navigation
paragraph.paragraph: To navigate between the pages, select the Next or Back buttons available on each page.
To cancel the wizard at any point, select the Cancel button
To complete the wizard, using the current settings, select the Finish button which is available from the Completion page.
paragraph.heading: 2Page content
paragraph.paragraph: This wizard is comprised of the following pages:
paragraph.heading: 3Welcome
paragraph.paragraph: This page contains a welcome message. There are no settings on this page.
paragraph.heading: 3Web Service
paragraph.paragraph: This page contains a text field into which you must enter a valid URL or path to the WSDL document, XSD schema or .disco map document from which you wish to generate your web service client project. URL locations should be entered directly into the text field, whereas if it is a file you are using to specify your project, you can click the browse button to bring up a file browse dialog.
At the bottom of the field is a combo box from which you can choose the protocol that you wish your project to use. You may select between SOAP, Http get and Http post.
paragraph.note: Note:You must enter a location or file into the text field, otherwise, when you click next, an error page will be displayed, stopping you from continuing with the wizard.
paragraph.heading: 3Authentication
paragraph.paragraph: This page is only displayed if you specified a http URL on the previous page.
If the web service to which you are connecting, requires authentication, check require authentication? and then enter the username, password and domain required.
If the web service requires a proxy, check require proxy? and then enter the URL, user name, password and domain.
paragraph.heading: 3Completion
paragraph.paragraph: As soon as this page is displayed, verification of your settings begins. Please be patient, as the verification may take anywhere from a few seconds up to a minute or two, dependent on the factors involved.
If the verification completes successfully, then you may click Finish to complete the wizard.
If the verification failed, then an error message will be displayed and you may click Back to modify the incorrect settings.
